name: Mini Crab Cakes with Curried Tartar Sauce
author: Maria Connors
summary: My family loves these. You don't need to use the curried tartar--you can use regular, but the curried tartar is what sets this recipe apart. I ask you to give it a try before deciding against it!
ingredients: ½ small red bell pepper, chopped
½ small green bell pepper, chopped
1 teaspoon seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®)
½ cup vegetable oil for frying, or as needed
directions: Mix mayonnaise, relish, mustard, hot sauce, garam masala, and cilantro for tartar sauce in a bowl until well blended
Cover and chill in the refrigerator until flavors have blended, about 1 hour
Melt butter in a frying pan
Add celery, onion, and bell peppers; saute until soft, about 5 minutes
Transfer to a bowl and set aside to cool
Place bread crumbs and crabmeat in a large bowl
Add cooled vegetables, eggs, seafood seasoning, pepper, and cayenne; mix until well blended and moist
Form crab mixture into 1 1/2- to 2-inch balls
Heat oil in a frying pan over medium or medium-low heat
Add crab balls and flatten the tops with a spatula
Fry to a golden brown, about 5 minutes
Carefully flip and repeat to brown the other side
